title: Wrongful Detentions & Deportations of U.S. Citizens
summary: ICE detained and deported U.S. citizens. Two U.S. citizen siblings (ages 4 and 7) deported to Honduras within 24 hours - 4-year-old had late-stage cancer and no medication. At least seven U.S. citizen children deported with parents. Tom Homan confirmed ICE made 'collateral arrests' of 'many' American citizens. Northwestern researcher estimated 1% of all ICE detainees are U.S. citizens. ICE has deported dozens of U.S. citizens.
keyFacts: Debbie Brockman - U.S. citizen and WGN-TV employee detained for seven hours in Chicago on October 10, 2025
Javier Ramirez - U.S. citizen born in San Bernardino detained by ICE on June 13, 2025
Jose Roberto Ramirez - Minneapolis-born U.S. citizen taken into custody by ICE in Minnesota on January 8, 2026
Two U.S. citizen siblings (ages 4 and 7) deported with undocumented mother to Honduras within 24 hours
4-year-old deportee had late-stage cancer and no medication
At least seven U.S. citizen children have been deported with their parents
Tom Homan (Border Czar) confirmed ICE made 'collateral arrests' of 'many' American citizens
Northwestern University researcher estimated 1% of all ICE detainees are U.S. citizens
ICE has deported dozens of U.S. citizens, according to reports
First-year budget allocated more than $170 billion over four years for border enforcement, $75 billion to ICE
